p: We used the complete chloroplast genomes sequence of P. simonii and 21 other related species to construct phylogenetic tree. The 22 chloroplast genome sequences were aligned with MAFFT (Katoh and Standley, 2013), and then the neighbour-joining tree was constructed by MEGA 7.0 (Kumar etÂ al. 2016). The neighbour-joining phylogenetic analysis showed that P. simonii and Populus qamdoensis clustered together as sisters to other Populus species ( Figure 1).
